item.title: Revisiting the US Foreign Policy to Support Saudi Arabia in Yemen (Poster Presentation)
item.description: The following poster was presented by Nimesh Babu Oli and Matthew Bennett (Students at the Bush School of Government and Public Service at Texas A&M University) as a part of Quantitative Methods project.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence and its implications on power dynamics in the Asia-Pacific region (Paper Presentation)
item.description: The following presentation was given at VIJIGISHU 2021 conference organized by Amity Institute of International Studies, Amity University, India on 2021/09/24. The advancement of emerging technology has already made a profound impact on all the domains and aspects of International Relations. The scope and power of Artificial Intelligence (AI) have...

item.title: Nepal Qatar Relations (Seminar)
item.description: Nepal and Qatar has a historic relations dating back to 1977, six years after the independence of Qatar from the United Kingdom. Since then, these two countries enjoys a cordial and harmonic relations. The following slides presents the comprehensive outlook on the state of relations between the two nations in...

item.title: Mixed Legacy of Trump Administration in the Middle East
item.description: Donald Trump was ascended to the throne on a promise of “America’s First” which contradicted the US’s position on a number of foreign policy issues. His way of framing US foreign policy almost totally in business terms neglecting the history, strategy and diplomacy had favored him by the American Public...

item.description: Due to the ongoing lockdown or some form of restrictions in the movement of people and doing businesses, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) has predicted a dire situation in the World Economy in which growth is projected to contract by 4.9 % in 2020. item.title: Impacts of COVID-19 on International Relations
item.description: Who had thought that our human civilization would be threatened by the outbreak of a pandemic and it will radically change the way of doing things? item.title: United Nations in the Contemporary World
item.description: UN has been a pioneering multilateral global body for the last 74 years in the area of humanitarian response, aiding the member states, preventing conflicts, maintaining peace and security.UN has been underrepresented, non-inclusive, and structurally partial in the exercise and powers in the decision making especially in its organ, the...

item.title: Possible US-Iran conflict and its impacts on Nepal
item.description: Have you ever thought about the impacts of the US-Iran conflict on Nepal? item.title: Diplomats, Diplomacy and the challenges in the Modern World
item.description: Diplomacy is simply the art, science, or management of the relationship between countries (eg. Russia, India, Nepal), international organizations (eg. World Bank, UN, IMF, EU) in a skillful way by the professionals called Diplomats. Diplomacy has always been a non-violent approach in maintaining relationships among nations and organizations through dialogue,...
